overview_of_class: This course is intended for students who would like to prepare for studying abroad or to deepen their cultural and linguistic knowledge regarding integration and multicultural life in Germany. The topics covered in the course will focus partly on topics covered in the integration course (Integrationskurs), a program developed in Germany specifically for immigrants. Topics will include the meaning of democracy, the political structures and political participation in Germany, Germany as a welfare state, a brief history of Germany in the 20th century and how it affects life in the 21st century, life in unified Germany and Europe, educational structures, religious and intercultural integration and social networks. This course will prepare students for the final examination, the "Life Germany" test, an examination written for immigrants in Germany.
name: History, Politics, and Culture in 21st Century German
subject: GERMAN
